title: Adverse Event Data
text: vignette documents use functions aeplots create tables plots analysing adverse event data clinical trials.
code: library(aeplots)

title: Adverse Event Data
text: generate tables plots summarise adverse events clinical trials, R package requires input dataset data frame format. sample dataset two treatment arms shown : Note participant experience adverse events, row included input dataset stating /id, arm, date_rand, last_visit variables included model. adverse_event, body_system_class severity column specified NA. example: need convert body_system_class severity columns factors. Note functions , need specify column names corresponding variable needed unless rename column names dataset default column names specified sample dataset documentation. refer detailed documentation function typing:
code: data(df2) head(df2, 10) tail(df2 %>%         add_row(id=2110, arm="Intervention", ae_pt=NA, aebodsys=NA, severity=NA, date_rand=ymd("2015-05-22"),                last_visit=ymd("2016-04-22"), variable1=2, variable2=1500), 1) df2$aebodsys <- as.factor(df2$aebodsys) # for severity to be presented in ascending order, we order the levels df2$severity <- ordered(df2$severity, c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe")) help(aetable)

title: Adverse Event Data
text: functions aetable, aeseverity, aestacked aebar can take 4 treatment arms. sample dataset 3 treatment arms:
code: data(df3) head(df3, 10) df3$aebodsys <- as.factor(df3$aebodsys) df3$severity <- ordered(df2$severity, c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe"))

title: Adverse Event Data
text: aetable plots table AE summary body system class arm. contains total number participants risk per arm (N1N_{1}, N2N_{2}), frequency (N), proportion (%), total number events (n), incidence rate (IR), number adverse events per participant (mean & SD) treatment effect estimate 95% confidence interval (CI). include additional covariates besides arm model, specify vector variable names variables argument.  can specify model used estimate treatment effect 95% CI via model argument. available model options Poisson (rate), Poisson (count), Negative Binomial (rate), Negative Binomial (count), Binomial (logit), Binomial (log) Binomial (identity).  can specify IR per number person via IR_per_person argument. default IR per 100 person.  can specify number decimal places proportions, IR, mean SD columns well number significant figures treatment effect estimate 95% CI.  can choose drop treatment effect estimate 95% CI specifying treatment_effect_estimate=FALSE.  can also choose drop mean column specifying mean=FALSE.
code: aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"),         treatment_effect_estimate=TRUE, variables = c("variable1", "variable2")) aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"),         treatment_effect_estimate=TRUE, model="Binomial (logit)", variables = c("variable1", "variable2")) aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"),         IR_per_person=1000) aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"),         treatment_effect_estimate=TRUE, variables = c("variable1", "variable2"), proportions_dp=2, IR_dp=2,         mean_dp=2, SD_dp=2, estimate_sf=4, CI_sf=4) aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"),         treatment_effect_estimate=FALSE) aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"),         treatment_effect_estimate=FALSE, mean=FALSE)

title: Adverse Event Data
text: aetable include treatment effect estimates 95% CIs datasets 2 treatment arms. change labels control interventions table, specify label control argument control_name specify intervention labels argument intervention_names. Note intervention_names specified using order interventions specified intervention_levels.
code: aetable(df3, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", control_name="No Drug",         intervention_levels=c("Intervention 1", "Intervention 2"), intervention_names=c("Drug A", "Drug B"))

title: Adverse Event Data
text: aeseverity plots table frequencies proportions events severity categories. specify number decimal places proportions via argument proportions_dp.  can choose drop number events column specifying n_events=FALSE.
code: aeseverity(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), body_system_class="aebodsys", proportions_dp=2) aeseverity(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), body_system_class="aebodsys", n_events=FALSE)

title: Adverse Event Data
code: aeseverity(df3, arm_levels=c("Intervention 1", "Intervention 2", "Placebo"),             arm_names=c("Drug A", "Drug B", "No Drug"), body_system_class="aebodsys", n_events=FALSE)

title: Adverse Event Data
text: aedot plots dot plot proportions alongside treatment effect estimates accompanying 95% confidence interval visualise AE harm profiles two-arm randomised controlled trials.  Similar aetable, can specify model used estimate treatment effect 95% CI via model argument. available model options unadjusted (RR), unadjusted (RD), Poisson (rate), Poisson (count), Negative Binomial (rate), Negative Binomial (count), Binomial (logit), Binomial (log) Binomial (identity). default model unadjusted (RR).  can change colours dots percentage participants plot dot_colours argument.
code: aedot(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention") aedot(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention", model="unadjusted (RD)") aedot(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention",        dot_colours=c("#F4B800", "#97D800"))

title: Adverse Event Data
text: aestacked plots stacked bar chart proportions body system class arm maximum severity. severity ordered, required specify levels severity ascending order argument severity_levels.  can change colour severity specifying vector colour codes corresponding severity level severity_colours argument.
code: aestacked(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"),            severity_levels=c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe")) aestacked(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"),            severity_levels=c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe"), severity_colours=c("#D0EE11", "#48B5C4", "#115F9A"))

title: Adverse Event Data
code: aestacked(df3, body_system_class="aebodsys", arm_levels=c("Intervention 1","Intervention 2", "Placebo"),           arm_names=c("Drug A","Drug B", "No Drug"), severity_levels=c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe"))

title: Adverse Event Data
text: aebar plots bar chart number events reported per participant.  can change colour representing treatment arm specifying vector colour codes arm_colours argument according order arm levels specified arm_levels argument.
code: aebar(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"), adverse_event="ae_pt", facets=FALSE) aebar(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"), adverse_event="ae_pt", arm_colours=c("#FFB55A", "#B2E061"), facets=FALSE)

title: Adverse Event Data
text: can plot bar chart treatment arm separate facets specifying facets=TRUE.
code: aebar(df3, arm_levels=c("Intervention 1","Intervention 2", "Placebo"), arm_names=c("Drug A","Drug B", "No Drug"),       adverse_event="ae_pt", facets=FALSE) aebar(df3, arm_levels=c("Intervention 1","Intervention 2", "Placebo"), arm_names=c("Drug A","Drug B", "No Drug"),       adverse_event="ae_pt", facets=TRUE)

title: Adverse Event Data
text: aevolcano plots volcano plot treatment effect estimate p-value -log10 scale.  can specify model used estimate treatment effect via model argument. available model options unadjusted (RD), unadjusted (RR), unadjusted (), unadjusted (IRR), Poisson (rate), Poisson (count), Negative Binomial (rate), Negative Binomial (count), Binomial (logit), Binomial (log) Binomial (identity). default model unadjusted (RD).  Labels added events p-values less 0.1 default. can change p-value cutoff labels added events p_value_cutoff argument.  default colours bubbles blue red, blue indicating greater risk control arm red indicating greater risk intervention arm. can change colour bubbles bubble_colours argument, specifying colour indicating greater risk control arm first, followed colour indicating greater risk intervention arm.
code: aevolcano(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention") aevolcano(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention", model="Binomial (logit)",           variables=c("variable1", "variable2")) aevolcano(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention", p_value_cutoff=0.05) aevolcano(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention", bubble_colours = c("#B2E061", "#FFB55A"))

title: Adverse Event Data
text: aemcf plots mean cumulative function (MCF) accompanying 95% confidence interval harm outcomes treatment arm embedded table number participants risk.  can plot MCF adverse events specific organ systems specific adverse events specifying conditions subset argument.   can change time units either seconds, minutes, hours, days, weeks, months years time_units argument.  can choose plot 95% confidence intervals specifying conf.int=FALSE.  can choose drop risk table specifying risk_table=FALSE.  can change colour representing treatment arm specifying vector colour codes arm_colours argument according order arm levels specified arm_levels argument.
code: aemcf(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), adverse_event="ae_pt", body_system_class="aebodsys") # this plots the MCF for adverse events of a specific body system class (i.e. Gastrointestinal) aemcf(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), subset= body_system_class=="Gastrointestinal", adverse_event="ae_pt",       body_system_class="aebodsys") # this plots the MCF for a specific adverse event (i.e. Anemia) aemcf(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), subset= adverse_event=="Anemia", adverse_event="ae_pt",       body_system_class="aebodsys") aemcf(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), adverse_event="ae_pt", body_system_class="aebodsys", time_units="weeks") aemcf(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), adverse_event="ae_pt", body_system_class="aebodsys", conf.int=FALSE) aemcf(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), adverse_event="ae_pt", body_system_class="aebodsys", risk_table=FALSE) aemcf(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), adverse_event="ae_pt", body_system_class="aebodsys",        arm_colours=c("#C77CFF", "#7CAE00"))

title: Adverse Event Data
code: aemcf(df3, arm_levels=c("Intervention 1", "Intervention 2", "Placebo"),        subset= body_system_class %in% c("Blood and lymphatic", "Respiratory"), adverse_event="ae_pt", body_system_class="aebodsys")

title: Adverse Event Data
text: can save tables docx specifying filepath save_docx_path argument.
code: aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"),         treatment_effect_estimate=TRUE, variables = c("variable1", "variable2"), save_docx_path="aetable.docx")

title: Adverse Event Data
text: can save tables plots images specifying filepath save_image_path argument.
code: aebar(df3, arm_levels=c("Intervention 1","Intervention 2", "Placebo"), arm_names=c("Drug A","Drug B", "No Drug"),       adverse_event="ae_pt", facets=TRUE, save_image_path="aeimage.png")

title: Laboratory Data
text: article documents use functions aeplots analyse laboratory data clinical trials.
code: library(aeplots)

title: Laboratory Data
text: generate tables plots summarise laboratory data clinical trials, R package requires input dataset data frame format. sample dataset two treatment arms shown : need convert visit column ordered factor. Note functions , need specify column names corresponding variable needed unless rename column names dataset default column names specified sample dataset documentation. refer detailed documentation function typing:
code: data(lab2) head(lab2, 10) lab2$visit <- ordered(lab2$visit, c("Week 0", "Week 4", "Week 8", "Week 12", "Week 16", "Week 20", "Week 24")) help(labtable)

title: Laboratory Data
text: function labtable can take 4 treatment arms. sample dataset 3 treatment arms:
code: data(lab3) tail(lab3, 10)

title: Create Tables and Plots for Analysing Adverse Event Data in Clinical Trials
text: Functions available package: aetable: Plots table AE summary body system class aeseverity: Plots table AE summary severity body system class aedot: Plots dot plot proportions alongside treatment effect estimates accompanying 95% confidence interval aestacked: Plots stacked bar chart present proportions participants event arm maximum severity aebar: Plots bar chart present number events reported per participant aevolcano: Plots volcano plot treatment effect estimate -log10(p-value) aemcf: Plots mean cumulative function AE risk table see detailed documentation function:
code: help(aetable) ?aetable

title: Create Tables and Plots for Analysing Adverse Event Data in Clinical Trials

title: Create Tables and Plots for Analysing Adverse Event Data in Clinical Trials

what: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
text: aedot creates plot summarises AE harm profiles via following visualisations: left panel: percentage participants event treatment group central panel: relative risk/ risk difference/ incidence rate ratio/ odds ratio observing event treatment group compared control group, along 95% confidence interval right panel: data table containing number participants least one event number events treatment group

title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
code: aedot(   data,   control,   intervention,   body_system_class = "body_system_class",   id = "id",   arm = "arm",   date_rand = "date_rand",   last_visit = "last_visit",   model = "unadjusted (RR)",   variables = c(),   dot_colours = c("red", "blue"),   save_image_path = NULL )

title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
text: data data frame adverse_event, body_system_class, id arm columns (optional: date_rand, last_visit variables included model) control factor level control arm intervention factor level intervention arm body_system_class name body_system_class column id name id column arm name arm column date_rand name date_rand column last_visit name last_visit column model unadjusted relative risk/risk difference model used computation treatment effect estimate 95% CI variables vector variable names included model computation treatment effect estimate (excluding arm) dot_colours vector colours dots percentage participants plot (left plot) save_image_path file path save dot plot image

title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
text: dot plot proportions alongside treatment effect estimates accompanying 95% confidence interval

title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
text: treatment effect 95% confidence interval estimated via following models : unadjusted (RR): unadjusted relative risk unadjusted (RD): unadjusted risk difference Poisson (rate): fitting generalised linear model Poisson family log link length follow time offset Poisson (count): fitting generalised linear model Poisson family log link count response Negative Binomial (rate): fitting Negative Binomial model length follow time offset Negative Binomial (count): fitting Negative Binomial model count response Binomial (logit): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family logit link Binomial (log): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family log link Binomial (identity): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family identity link default model unadjusted (RR) model. Poisson Negative Binomial models, treatment effect estimate Incidence Rate Ratio (IRR). Binomial (logit) model, treatment effect estimate Odds Ratio (). Binomial (log) model, treatment effect estimate Relative Risk (RR). Binomial (identity) model, treatment effect estimate Risk Difference (RD). reference group treatment arm regression model control arm. Additional covariates besides arm can added model via argument variables. Note interaction terms added model.

title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
code: df2$aebodsys <- as.factor(df2$aebodsys) aedot(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention") #> Bin width defaults to 1/30 of the range of the data. Pick better value with #> `binwidth`.

what: Mean cumulative function plot for harm outcomes by treatment group — aemcf
title: Mean cumulative function plot for harm outcomes by treatment group — aemcf
text: aemcf plots mean cumulative function (MCF) adverse events, adverse events specific organ systems specific adverse events embedded table number participants risk. nonparametric MCF estimates (Nelson-Aalen estimator) approximate 95% confidence intervals obtained using mcf function reda package.

title: Mean cumulative function plot for harm outcomes by treatment group — aemcf

title: Mean cumulative function plot for harm outcomes by treatment group — aemcf

what: Volcano plot of AEs between two treatment arms to help identify potential signals of harm — aevolcano
title: Volcano plot of AEs between two treatment arms to help identify potential signals of harm — aevolcano
text: aevolcano creates volcano plot treatment effect estimate following characteristics: x-axis represents treatment effect estimate (risk difference/ relative risk / odds ratio/ incidence rate ratio) y-axis represents p-value estimated via two-tailed Fisher's exact test model fitted -log10 scale centre bubble indicates coordinates adverse event size bubble proportional total number events treatment arms combined colour saturation corresponds -log10(p-value), indicating strength treatment effect red indicating greater risk intervention arm blue indicating greater risk control arm labels added events p-value less 0.1

title: Volcano plot of AEs between two treatment arms to help identify potential signals of harm — aevolcano
code: aevolcano(   data,   control,   intervention,   body_system_class = "body_system_class",   id = "id",   arm = "arm",   date_rand = "date_rand",   last_visit = "last_visit",   model = "unadjusted (RD)",   variables = c(),   bubble_colours = c("#2b3bff", "#e14b31"),   p_value_cutoff = 0.1,   save_image_path = NULL )

title: Volcano plot of AEs between two treatment arms to help identify potential signals of harm — aevolcano

title: Volcano plot of AEs between two treatment arms to help identify potential signals of harm — aevolcano
text: treatment effect p-value estimated via following models : unadjusted (RD): unadjusted risk difference p-value obtained via two-tailed Fisher's exact test unadjusted (RR): unadjusted relative risk p-value obtained via two-tailed Fisher's exact test unadjusted (): unadjusted odds ratio p-value obtained via two-tailed Fisher's exact test unadjusted (IRR): unadjusted incidence rate ratio p-value obtained via two-tailed Fisher's exact test Poisson (rate): fitting generalised linear model Poisson family log link length follow time offset Poisson (count): fitting generalised linear model Poisson family log link count response Negative Binomial (rate): fitting Negative Binomial model length follow time offset Negative Binomial (count): fitting Negative Binomial model count response Binomial (logit): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family logit link Binomial (log): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family log link Binomial (identity): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family identity link default model unadjusted (RD) model. Poisson Negative Binomial models, treatment effect estimate Incidence Rate Ratio (IRR). Binomial (logit) model, treatment effect estimate Odds Ratio (). Binomial (log) model, treatment effect estimate Relative Risk (RR). Binomial (identity) model, treatment effect estimate Risk Difference (RD). reference group treatment arm regression model control arm. Additional covariates besides arm can added model via argument variables. Note interaction terms added model.
